name: 陳雅玫
objective: This course aims to provide students with the skills and principles of news reporting and news writing. Different types of journalistic writings will be introduced, including hard/soft news, feature stories, commentaries and interviews. Plenty of discussion will take place in class and active participation is highly required of students.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction
Week 2: N/A
Week 3: news writing style
Week 4: language of news
Week 5: news headlines
Week 6: news leads
Week 7: Guest Speaker 1
Week 8: the body of a news story 
Week 9: quotations and attributes
Week 10: feature writing (I)
Week 11: feature writing (II)
Week 12: opinion writing (I)
Week 13: opinion writing (II)
Week 14: Guest Speaker 2
Week 15: interviewing techniques (I)
Week 16: interviewing techniques (II)
Week 17: oral presentations
Week 18: Wrap up
scorePolicy:
1. attendance and participation: 15%
2. in-class quizzes and assignments: 35%  
3. group writing assignments and oral presentations: 40%
4. the end-of-semester writing portfolio: 10%
materials:
1.　　Bartel, J. C. 2006. The Metropolitan Daily News: Understanding American Newspapers. Taiwan: Pearson Education Ltd.
2.　　McIntyre, B. T. 1996. English News Writing. Hong Kong: the Chinese University Press.
3.　　Bender, J. R., Davenport, L. D., Drager, M. W., and Fedler, F. 2009. Reporting for the Media. 9th edition. New York and Oxford: Oxford University Press.
4.　　Fox, Walter. 2001. Writing the News: A Guide for Print Journalists. 3rd edition. Ames: Iowa State University Press.
